data.answer: The suffix given is ı. The suffix ı is added directly to the word root devam. Since there is only one suffix, the order of application is straightforward. There are no phonetic changes or alterations in the root structure when ı is appended to devam. The derived word devamı is grammatically correct. <Yes>
data.sentence: plüton bize ilk dersini verdi ___ da gelecek

data.answer: First, imiz then liğ is applied to the root birlikte. According to Turkish grammar rules, this order of suffixes is not permissible, leading to the conclusion that the derived word is grammatically incorrect. <No>
data.sentence: sanırım yıllar süren ___ sonucunda onun bana zarar vermeyeceğine karar verdim ve ona güvendim

data.answer: Answer: First, ir then ken is applied to the root birlikte. According to Turkish grammar rules, this order of suffixes is allowed, leading to the conclusion that the derived word is grammatically correct. <Yes>
data.sentence: kardeş kardeş ___ nasıl her yıl bir moriskoluyu yakmayı adet edindiler
